result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles E Braxton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Each count concur. State will agree to termination of probation after 15 months provided defn has completed all conditions of probation & the agent agrees in writing.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. To be collected by the Dept of Corrections.

$200 DNA surcharge remitted.  $343 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Write a letter to adult victims daughter 16 yrs old & give to agent. Completion of certified domestic violence treatment.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
$243 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles E Braxton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation - GRANTED.  Date of Discharge 10/04/2017
Probation Agent recommending early discharge from probation pursuant to Sec. 973.09(3)(d) Wis. Stats.

Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom; witness called, sworn & testified; direct exam by ADA McMiller, exhibit #1 marked; witness id'd defn; cross exam by defn; witness excused; offered exhibit #1; defn sworn & took witness stand, offered testimony; questioned by ADA McMiller; further argument by parties; Ct questioned parties; Ct ruled amending restitution.
Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom; defn present, ADA McMiller requests continuance because of victim notification; Ct gives out another RSH; Ct adjourned.
Restitution hearing on July 5, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Restitution hearing on June 20, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with K.J.B. or Larry L.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Kelly O. except incidental contact at work.
- Defendant shall not be in the 800 block of Columbus St in Sun Prairie, WI.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
Trial Judge - Br 12

Defendant appeared.  Chelsea E Wetjen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 09:45 am.
